reviewText:
Early Access Review

A 2D Vertical Platformerhttps://youtu.be/OxINQ5gaK4Y
+ Visually it looks really good
+ A lot of levels / content

This game is in Early Access so don't take these too seriously
- The controls don't feel right, especially when jumping, sometimes it seems like jump presses are not registered making double or triple jumps a bit tedius to pull off
- No gamepad support (Note to devs: please add xbox controller support)
- It's hard to tell what your character is... the steam page says it's a stump of a finger"...with legs? What a strange abomination....
- No intro story or context as to what the thing is above your head or why you are collecting things for it
- No way to zoom out the camera to see more of the stage
date: a majority of the time I was just doing leaps of faith "hoping" a platform would appear on the other side or below...\n\nOverall I think this platformer has too many flaws at the moment to recommend
recommended: but hopefully they will be fixed with future updates."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Hardest part of the game so far is the s**t controlles. Played for about 10min and after dying about 30 times because the inputs don't always regester I've given up. Simply dropping from one ledge to the one below it can prove futile as the... thumb(?) seems to want to launch itself off everything making every step a roll of the dice if you get to live or start over. If input recognition and control gets fixed, it could be a fun game, but till then, it's not.

Pro:
+Interesting avatar, a dissembodied thumb-knight thing.
+Looks and runs well.

Con:
-Controls
-No story. Not asking much here, just a simple thing like You are the thumb of a great knight
date: cut from him during battle. Make your way back to him so he can continue to fight."\n-What is that thing floating over me
hoursPlayed: I'm playing as a dissembodied thumb-knight thing so what's a floating shape thing matter."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Terrible game. The developer is probably in primary or high school.
The controls simply don't always register, the jumps are random. If the controls don't work properly,
that means the game is broken. There's plenty more wrong here, but now that you know the controls don't work you won't have to read through all the other problems either...

Pros:
- Good music

Cons:
- Bad controls
- Boring level design
(- Terrible English , which adds to the unprofessional characterstic of this game)

1/10

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe game looks really promising. The story is unique and funny. There are many interesting levels in the game and you must make up your mind what to do next, because the game is not that simple as it might look in the begginig. Still it need some work , but I think it will be a great game to play in the end. I will be looking forward to play new levels and understand the story of the character. The game is recommended for all platformer lovers. You will have a great time, I think. )

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nLooks promising, but too hard to play (for me) with only WSAD + space controls.  I would much prefer controller support.  After playing consoles for years, I honestly couldn't make it off the first platform.  It is unplayable to me in its current state (early-release).  But if I could control the character, it looks like an interesting mechanic. (good for trading cards, until controller support added).

reviewText:
Early Access Review

THIS IS AN EARLY ACCESS REVIEW, TAKE IT WITH A GRAIN OF SALT
Overall, I didn't really care for this game.  I get that it is in Early Access, but that doesn't mean that the game can't still be good.  Just look at Unturned, still in Early Access I think, it's a solid game.  But in its current state, this game as platformer, it just doesn't work.  The jumping is really clunky.  I thought I had it at one point, but the idiot decides to jump off a platform.  Also, why is there no controllable double jump?  And even after buying the Jump Three Times thing in the shop, how does it work?  Don't get me wrong, this game looks great and has the potential to be something great, but not right now.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Got this game at a discount through another Steam badge. Completed all released 42 levels (plus secret and boss stages) and achievements in 6 hours.
+ Beautiful 2D graphics
+ Addicting gameplay
+ Music is nice
+ Casual, indie game to pass the time (won't take you hours)
- Frustrating controls, doesn't always register (I worry I'll break my spacebar) + doesn't support controller
- Needs better English translation
- Causes PC to run slow or overheat when other applications are open
- Some minor bugs here and there but it's all part of Early Access

Though I won't play this again, will still recommend because I did like the artwork.
